TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit NamedImage extends System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartNamedElement

Docs.summary: Represents named images, which are stored in the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.NamedImage> class represents an image that has a unique name, and is useful when an image is dynamically created using a particular drawing routine, and then specified as the image for one of the image properties of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> control.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.NamedImage.Name%2A> property determines the unique name of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.NamedImage> object. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.NamedImage.Image%2A> property determines its associated image, which can be any object derived from the .NET Framework <xref:System.Drawing.Image> class.
When one of the image properties of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> control is set by specifying a `string` value, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.Images%2A> collection property is first checked to determine whether an image with the specified name exists. If a matching <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.NamedImage> object is found, this image is used. If a matching <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.NamedImage> object is not located, the `string` value is treated as a URL, image resource name, or an image path.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.NamedImage.Image%2A> property determines which image is stored in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.NamedImage> object.
Use <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.NamedImage> objects for dynamically created images, which can then be assigned to a chart image property.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the unique name of a object.
Docs.value: A value that represents the unique name of a object stored in the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The property identifies a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.NamedImage> object that is stored in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.NamedImagesCollection>. This name must be unique, or an exception will be thrown when the object is added to the collection.
Use <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.NamedImage> objects for dynamically created images, which can then be assigned to a chart image property.
This <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.NamedImage.Name%2A> property value is used when you set a chart image property to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.NamedImage> object.
When one of the image properties of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> control is set by specifying a `string` value, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.Images%2A> collection property - of type <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.NamedImagesCollection> - is first checked to determine whether an image with the specified name exists. If a matching <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.NamedImage> object is found, this image is used. If a matching <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.NamedImage> object is not located, the `string` value is treated as a URL, an image resource name, or an image path.
